inventory.commentary: Too many VPCs to include in this file. A number of idioms are also not included here.

sense.name: position or place something
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] LAY NP2[patient] (PP{P NP[location]}) Notes: denotes a simple, single movement, or simple repetitive movements.
sense.examples: She tried to lay her head against the window to sleep. He laid the watch to his ear. The manager has laid the rumor to rest. (metaphoric) The mother lay the baby in the cradle. If we could only lay our hands on some good Bordeaux! (figurative)

sense.name: to set in order; construct by placing in position
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] LAY NP2[patient] Note: denotes a complex activity, not a simple movement.
sense.examples: After dinner, John lay a fire in the study for us. It's not enough to lay good plans, you must execute them well also. Those men lay brick for a living. The foundation for this peace negotiation was laid in the last treaty. The Railroad Museum will be laying track this spring and summer. They are laying a trail for the children's 'fox' hunt. John's political enemies are laying a trap for him.

sense.name: deposit, as eggs
sense.examples: Don't kill the goose that lays the golden eggs. Her most productive hens can lay an egg a day.

sense.name: impose, levy
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] LAY NP2[patient[abstract]] PP{P NP[target]}
sense.examples: He laid the blame on Mary. They are laying additional tariffs on hotel and restaurant services.

sense.name: save up for future use
sense.commentary: Includes: LAY ASIDE; LAY AWAY; LAY IN
sense.examples: He lays aside 500 dollars a month for retirement. I've laid away my mother's china for my daughter to have when she's grown. They laid in bushels of grain for the winter.

sense.name: LAY DOWN--establish, enact, institute
sense.examples: The new principal laid down the law for the students.

sense.name: LAY INTO--attack, hit or criticise violently
sense.examples: He laid into his sister for sneaking off.

sense.name: LAY OFF--put an end to a state or activity
sense.examples: Will you lay off?! He should lay off the drinking.

sense.name: LAY OFF--dismiss from a job
sense.examples: She got laid off when the company downsized.

sense.name: LAY OUT--array in an orderly way items, ideas, etc.
sense.examples: He lay out the candles from largest to smallest. Will you lay out my clothes for the party? Let me lay out my arguments. She laid out her proposed plans for the renovation.

sense.name: LAY OUT--spend or invest
sense.examples: He laid out a lot of cash for that ring. The company laid out millions to create the new department.

sense.name: LAY OVER--interrupt a journey overnight
sense.examples: I had to lay over in Houston.

sense.name: LAY OVER-- place on top of
sense.examples: Can you lay this image over the other one?

sense.name: LAY UP--disable or confine
sense.examples: He was really laid up because of the flu.

sense.name: multi-word expressions
sense.commentary: Includes: LAY CLAIM; LAY EYES ON; LAY HANDS ON; LAY ON THE LINE; LAY TO REST; LAY WASTE TO
sense.examples: He laid claim to the corner office. That is the most beautiful vase I've ever laid eyes on. Try to lay your hands on some Cuban cigars. She really laid it on the line when she confronted her boss. He was laid to rest on hill overlooking the river. The invading forces laid waste to the city.
